Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2012 06:50PM pumela115 wrote: liveit56, i would start looking for a new doctor too. I had an mri last mon., my onc called me tues night at 9pm to tell me i needed a biopsy. So hopefully they are not so speedy because of B9 results, but if not i would start looking fast. Best of luck! Pam
Posts.Title: Feeling so upset at doctor liveit56 liveit56

Posts.Content: May 10, 2011 10:15AM pumela115 wrote: Hi Justdiagnosed,   Boy it sounds so familiar. Last year at this time i was also diagnosed, can't beleive it has been a year. My turmor was 1.2cm at biopsy , they told me 3 lymph nodes were involved also. As it turned out my tumor was 2.2cm and 6 nodes were involved. They really won't know the exacts until you have your surgery. I had chemo, radiation and now have to take a pill for five years. What i can tell you is it has gone by so fast and it all was doable. Don't worry about it spreading as breast cancer is slow growing and a few weeks will not matter. I wish you the best of luck and let us know how it all turns out. One day at a time!                                                                          Pam
Posts.Title: just diagnosed with bc justdiagnosed AJTAYLOR

Posts.Content: May 19, 2013 01:05AM pumela115 wrote: Hi Ladies, I too had problems with my toenails. They turned black and hurt so bad! It's been two and half years since i had chemo and i'm still dealing with it. My podiatrist say it's a fungus caused by the chemo, because we can't fight it off. He had me take a round of lamisil (sp) and they look much better. You just have to wait for the nail to grow out, which takes forever. I hope this helps, but i would check with your onc because the lamisil is hard on the liver. Pam

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2010 04:35AM pumela115 wrote: Hi,   I also had problems with my eyes. It started on the last treatment.of the AC, they were so watery and swollen and my nose would not stop running as well. But my eyes were blurry for a while after and they still water off and on. My onc sent me to the eye Dr as it is very common for the tear ducts to get clogged, that was not the case with me. It sounds like you are having a little different symtoms as i had. But i would ask your onc about it and maybe go see the eye dr, but i'm sure it's from the treatment and should clear up shortly after you are done. I hope it gets better for you soon. you can get some eye drops that will give you some relief.

Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2011 05:49PM pumela115 wrote:      Hi Everyone,       Been reading this thread since the beginning, and love it. My hair started growing back while still in chemo. I had very curly hair and i was hoping it would come back straight but no such luck. It's not very long but very thick. It is very white on top and very black in the back. I have been coloring it for so long i wasn't sure what the real color is. I don't have the nerve to go topless yet maybe in a month (don't really know what to do with it :D) But very thankful to just have some hair. Before chemo i had alot of hair, enough for two people, so i'm hoping it thins a little. Everyone is different, so for you guys that don't have much yet be patient it will come and once it starts it comes in fast.  Lago- I have problems with my two big toenails also.. At first i thought they were going to fall off and now they look like they just stopped growing. hmmmm.....I really don't want to go back to the foot doctor, so many doctors yada yada yada .But i  might have to. Any suggestions? Anyway just wanted to say hi and i love seeing all the pics, i would post some but have no idea how. I hope everyone is having a great weekend.                                                          Pam P.S. My last chemo was Jan 13th and my last rads will be April 13th. I'm hoping the number 13 will be lucky for me!

Posts.Content: May 2, 2011 07:43PM pumela115 wrote: Hi everyone, my last chemo was Jan 13th. My hair started growing back while i was on abraxane it was about the last four treatments i think. I had really thick curley, curley hair and i used to use chemicals to straighten it all my life. It took me about 2 hours to fix my hair. If nothing else this cancer has taught me that i will NOT  spend that much money or time on my hair ever again!!! I thought when i lost it, that i would be devasted, but  the opposite happened. It was a relief!  Anyway i have been lucky, i don't use anything and i have almost 2 inches, i have had one trim and i tried to dye it myself, it looks like i dipped it in carmel on the top. Next time i will have it done professionally. It is still very curley and thick and everyone seems to think it looks better short, so i think i will keep it short, but not quite this short. I really would love some bangs. lol I think just like everything else with cancer, everyone is different. I hated when people would say that to me, but it is so true. I love to look at all the pictures of everyone's hair (i don't know how to post mine or i would) it gives us all hope. You all look so beautiful at all the stages!! Please keep posting. By this time next year our hair will be a thing of the past just like this cancer!! Have a wonderful evening everyone!!!                                                                          Pam
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 19, 2011 02:59AM - edited May 19, 2011 07:30AM by pumela115 Aimee, Yes this week is going to be so nice and it's about time. If your interested there is a thread on here called  Crazy Sexy Cancer in Seattle, i think thats what it's called and we all went out to dinner once and it was really fun. We were suppose to do it again this month, but i don't know what's going on now. If your interested i will keep you posted, if not we could meet sometime. Marybe I'm so sorry you have to go through this again. Nobody should have to do it more than once. I hope the new chemo kicks some cancers butt!! You will be in my thoughts and prayers. Best of Luck!!! Lago, Thanks again for posting my pics. You are my computer hero!! OK now i have to get some sleep. G'night everyone!                                                               Pam

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 03:06PM pumela115 wrote: Ok yesterday was my first day at work without my wig. I was really nervous, but it went well. Most people said they liked my hair and a couple even said it took ten years off of me. It's kinda funny cuz it's so grey now. I planned on getting rid of the wig in about a month, but my son told me to just do it! It  felt scary but really freeing!  It's pretty thick but not very long and it is so grey, but i think i like the color. I had very curly hair before chemo and i was hoping it would be straight but no such luck. Oh well just glad i have some hair. It is colder without it. Hope everyone is having a good day! I'm off to rads #26, can't wait to be DONE!!!                                                                                       Pam
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 08:38PM pumela115 wrote: Ann, Your hair looks great! Christine, my last chemo was Jan. 13th. It's funny how i can't remember this morning but i remember that date like it was yesterday. :D My hair started growing before i was done with chemo, can't remember when though. The chemo i had was 12x abraxane. It's similar to taxol, but i didn't have to take the steroids with it. Be patient with it, once it starts, it comes in really fast. I just got to tell you guys, after rads went upstairs to visit my nurse that would give me my chemo, just to say hi. It's the first time i have been in that room since i finished, and it gave me a weird feeling, sure hoping never to have to be there again, except to say hi. On a lighter note only 7 more rads to go!! WooooHoooooo!!!!!! Take Care everyone, going outside for a little bit, the sun is out in Seattle (doesn't happen very ofter) Have a great night to all!                                                        Pam
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 19, 2011 02:27PM pumela115 wrote: I also went to the look good feel good class, and it was so much fun! They had to kick us out of the room because we went way over the time and they needed the room for something else. They gave us a big bag full of really good make up and i'm still using it a year later. I have to admit it wasn't so much about the make up as meeting lots of people going through the same things that i was going through. They also had wigs for anyone who wanted one, i had bought 3 that i donated and one lady loved one of the ones i brought, so it made me feel good that i could help her. I hope you have a great time! Also learned alot of tips about scarfs and they showed us how to use a tee shirt to use on your head, it was very cool.                                                                  Pam

I'm wishing you really good luck with your hair and i hope the Abraxane kicks some cancers butt!!!!   Dragonfly- Lookin good!!! Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 03:24AM pumela115 wrote: Lago, yes we were on the same schedule. Really glad to be done. When we were doing chemo i thought time was going so slow, but now when i think about it (and i do often) this past year has really gone by fast. June 9th will be a year since my surgery. Rachel, your hair looks great! My hair seems to be growing fast and it is very curley in the back but straighter on the top. So i guess i have half a jewish girl fro. lol! The bangs are taking the longest and i so wish i had them. In good time i'm sure.  I have to agree with Lago and Marjie about the texture, soft but kinda weird feeling. I should take pictures more often but i don't really like looking at me so much. But maybe i'll start so i can notice my progress. Is anyone taking Arimedex?  I just started about a month ago and i've heard it slows down hair growth. I sure hope not. Posts.Title: How often are we getting tumor markers checked? shelly56 SSInUK

Posts.Content: pumela115 wrote: Hi Ladies,   i was just wondering if anyone else has had this problem. I finished my 4th AC infusion 3 weeks ago and my eyes are swollen and tearing so bad, also my nose will not stop running. I went to the eye doctor and he gave me drops to put in them 3 times a day. It's been 7 days with the drops and they have gotten a little better, but they have not cleared up by any means. Sometimes my vision is also a little blurry, and i don't know what i would do if i couldn't play on the computer :). Tomorrow i start Abraxane x12 and i am worried that it will make it worse. Has anyone else had this experience? and if so is there anything that you know would help? Thanks!  Good Luck to all of us in this fight! Dx 5/17/2010, IDC, 2cm, Grade 3, 6/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 6/9/2010 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 7/30/2010 Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide) Radiation Therapy 3/1/2011 Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help! Runny eyes and nose. pumela115 LJ13-2

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2010 09:16PM pumela115 wrote: Mine started falling out exactly 14 days from my first DD ACtreatment also. When i brushed it the brush was just full of my hair. I too just shaved it. It was falling on my arms and in my food, i couldn't stand it. My scalp was also itchy and it hurt just a little. I thought it was going to be really hard for me but that has been the least of my problems. The really great thing is i am not spending any money on it like coloring and straighting, no more expensive shampoo or conditioner.I wish you the best! Just make sure you have some hats and scarfs or a wig before you shave it. :D

Posts.Title: The sensitive subject Bernicky mrsnjband

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 08:29PM pumela115 wrote: Hi  everyone, this is such a great question, just last wed i asked my onc that exact question. I am doing abraxane x 12 and then rads, and i asked him how will they know if the chemo is working? Basically they don't, he said (i should also mention i started with DD AC x4). They will just watch me closely. So i guess it's just a crap shoot! No nobody is safe :( and it is really scary. None of my friends have had it (i hope they never do) but they don't understand, so i'm really glad i found this site. Back to the question, my Dr said it also spreads through the blood, which i think someone already mentioned. thanks for letting me vent.                                                         Pam

Posts.Title: Survivor photo shoot everyminute pupfoster1

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2011 02:46AM pumela115 wrote: Hi Anacortes Girl, Funny you mention this. I have had 3 Bladder infections since i started Arimidex. I don't know if that has anything to do with it, but i've never had them before. Oh by the way i've only been taking them for three months. My regular doctor says if i get one more off to the urologist for me too. Are you on AL'S? I know what you mean by feeling pressure, when i don't have one i still feel the pressure. I also tested neg for one of them, but the doc did a culture to see if the infection was behind the bladder i think, or something like that, but that also was neg at the time.Maybe you can ask about having a culture done also. I'm sending you good thoughts that it will be no big deal. Pls keep me posted as maybe i can figure out what is causing my pressure too!

Posts.Title: When / or Did you have your Port Removed after Chemo? laurie2025 Spookiesmom

Posts.Content: Dec 19, 2010 07:44PM pumela115 wrote: Hi Julie,  I did 4 DD AC and i think the whole infusion time is about 2 to 3 hours, but of course that doesn't include the blood draws before and then i would have to talk to the doctor before i went for the treatment. I think i was there for 5 hours for the whole thing. I am doing Abraxane now, i only have 3 left, hopefully i can get through the last 3, anyway it is similar to Taxol and it only takes about an hour to put through, but i still have to get my blood drawn and talk to my doctor before the infusions. Good Luck!! I didn't have to many side effects from the AC but i was very, very tired.Come back and let us know how it goes! Pam
